column1: Mrs. Darling loved to have everything just so
column2: and Mr. Darling had a passion for being exactly like his neighbors; so
column4: they had a nurse. As they were poor
column5: owing to the amount of milk the children drank
column6: this nurse was a prim Newfoundland dog
column8: who had belonged to no one in particular until the Darlings engaged her. She had always thought children important
column10: and the Darlings had become acquainted with her in Kensington Gardens
column11: where she spent most of her spare time peeping into perambulators
column12: and was much hated by careless nursemaids
column13: whom she followed to their homes and complained of to their mistresses. She proved to be quite a treasure of a nurse. How thorough she was at bath-time
column14: and up at any moment of the night if one of her charges made the slightest cry. Of course her kennel was in the nursery. She had a genius for knowing when a cough is a thing to have no patience with and when it needs stocking around your throat.
